byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and AL BAKER

abstract: New York City officials have been implementing shift in strategy for dealing with school shootings and other attacks like shooting at Planned Parenthood clinic in Colorado, which demonstrated dangers faced by first responders; consensus has emerged among law enforcement officials and experts that best way to save lives in such situations is for initial responders to intervene immediately; some 3,000 NYC patrol officers have been trained so far for so-called active shooter situations.
lead_paragraph: Ordinary New York City patrol officers, often armed with only a handgun and likely to arrive first at a shooting or another assault, are being trained to head into unfolding attacks and confront the perpetrators.

headline.main: Rushing to End Mass Shootings, Police Face Greater Danger
headline.print_headline: The City’s First Line of Defense, on the Beat and in Terrorist Attacks
